results.name: Desert Strike: Return to the Gulf
results.description: A top-down isometric helicopter shoot 'em up originally for the Sega Genesis, which was later ported to a variety of platforms. It is best known for its open-ended mission design and was followed by several sequels.

results.name: Breakfree
results.description: Breakfree is a block-breaking game that is similar to Breakout; however, it is played from a first-person perspective.

results.name: The Chessmaster 2000
results.description: The Chessmaster 2000 is the chess game that began the Chessmaster franchise. It was developed by The Software Toolworks, featuring a chess engine written by David Kittinger.

results.name: Bass Avenger
results.description: Put on some tight red spandex pants and grab your four-string in this atrocious fishing game from S&S Interactive.

results.name: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2007
results.description: Smackdown Vs. Raw 2007 is the third installment in the Smackdown Vs. Raw series.

results.name: Camelot Warriors
results.description: Camelot Warriors is an action / adventure 8-bit game developed in Spain by Dinamic Software. It was very popular in Spain and was even a packed-in game (along others) for a long time in Armstrad CPCs.

results.name: Super Spy Hunter
results.description: A vehicular combat game for the NES. It was originally called Battle Formula in Japan, but Sunsoft purchased the license to Spy Hunter and was able to market the game as a sequel to the Spy Hunter game.

results.name: Fritz 9: Play Chess
results.description: Fritz 9: Play Chess is a chess game for the PC developed by ChessBase. It features and advanced chess engine, video tutorials, online play and is able to analyze your chess ability as well as those of great players from the past.

results.name: The Real Deal 2
results.description: The Real Deal 2 is a collection of 17 classic card games.

results.name: Gothmog's Lair
results.description: Text adventure game for the Commodore 64

results.name: Blade & Sword
results.description: Blade & Sword is a Samurai-themed action RPG for the PC developed by Pixel Studio, a Chinese developer.

results.name: Premier Manager 98
results.description: Premier Manager '98 is the fifth game in the Premier Manager series. It covers the 1997/1998 English football season.

results.name: Mary-Kate and Ashley: Sweet 16: Licensed to Drive
results.description: Like Mario Party but bad!

results.name: Kampfgruppe
results.description: Kampfgruppe is a WWII strategy game by SSI. The german word Kampfgruppe refers to a flexible combat formation of any kind, and more specifically to those formations used by Germany during WWII.

results.name: EGA-Roids
results.description: EGA-Roids is an Asteroids-like game developed by Designer Software. It was created to show off the new EGA graphics capabilities introduced at the time.

results.name: Sportfischen Professional
results.description: Sportfischen Professional is a fishing simulation developed by Radon Labs for the PC. It features detailed 3D graphics, 7 different fishing areas and many playing modes.

results.name: Metal Slug X: Super Vehicle - 001
results.description: Metal Slug X is an upgraded version of Metal Slug 2, featuring the Metal Slug 3 game engine. The story remains the same but there are slight changes to music, gameplay and interactions.

results.name: Aisle
results.description: A text adventure game created by Sam Barlow. One unique characteristic of this game is that players only have one turn to perform an action before the game ends. After each attempt, little by little, the story unfolds.

results.name: Burntime
results.description: Burntime is a strategy/role-playing game played from a top-down perspective and set in a post-apocalyptic desert world.

results.name: Land of Legends
results.description: Fantasy turn-based strategy game

results.name: The X-Files Game
results.description: The X-Files Game is a point-and-click FMV adventure based on the hit Fox TV show, which aired from 1993 to 2002.

results.name: Dragon's Lair
results.description: Known as the granddaddy of the "Quick Time Event", Dragon's Lair is an interactive cartoon that lets players help guide the actions of brave knight Dirk the Daring, as he ventures through the dangerous castle of Singe the Dragon in order to rescue his beloved princess Daphne.

results.name: Covert Front: Episode One - All Quiet on Covert Front
results.description: The first entry in the adventure series, Covert Front, which follows a spy named Kara during an alternate, technologically advanced version of World War I.

results.name: BALLOONrain
results.description: A puzzle game for the PC, available from Mana Games. BALLOONrain contains hundreds of levels centering around removing balloons from the playing field.

results.name: Pogo
results.description: On a quest to escape the planet Steps, Pogo must color all of the 28 steps in each level of the game.

results.name: Romantic Encounters at the Dome
results.description: Romantic Encounters at the Dome is a text based game.

results.name: Drug Watch
results.description: Drug Watch is a game that intends to educate players on the dangers of illicit drugs.

results.name: The Ninja
results.description: The Ninja, who must battle enemy ninjas using knives and throwing stars.

results.name: Slam City with Scottie Pippen
results.description: A one-on-one streetball game that utilized full-motion video sequences and simplistic controls for gameplay.

results.name: Batman Begins
results.description: Ascend from a billionaire playboy to a feared superhero in the third-person adventure game tie-in to the 2005 feature film of the same name. It is the only game to be based on The Dark Knight Trilogy.

results.name: NATO Commander
results.description: Developed by Sid Meier in 1983, players are entrenched in a Cold War scenario in which the Soviet Union invades Germany. In charge of the NATO ground forces, players must choose where to place their resources and what their role will be.

results.name: The Adventures of Death: Episode One - Emo Harvest on the Oregon Trail
results.description: It has emo and Oregon in the title, what more is there to say?

results.name: FIFA Soccer 07
results.description: The famous soccer game comes back this year with updated teams and players. The control mechanics were modified, featuring heavy use of the skill stick, and upping the tempo of the entire game.

results.name: Virtua Fighter 2
results.description: The second game in Sega-AM2's signature 3D fighting game series builds upon its predecessor with significantly improved graphics, new gameplay mechanics, and two new fighters.

results.name: Uru: Ages Beyond Myst
results.description: Cyan's first venture to bring both online gameplay to the Myst universe and to create a 3rd person adventure game based on the Myst franchise.

results.name: Ganbare Goemon Gaiden: Kieta Ougon Kiseru
results.description: An RPG spin-off of Konami's Ganbare Goemon series, where Goemon has to solve the mystery of his missing pipe.

results.name: RC Revenge Pro
results.description: Sequel to RC car-themed kart racer RC Revenge.

results.name: F-Zero: Maximum Velocity
results.description: The first portable entry in Nintendo's fast-paced sci-fi series F-Zero and a launch title for the Game Boy Advance.

results.name: Romance of the Three Kingdoms VIII
results.description: The eighth installment of the historical turn-based strategy game from Koei based off the novel "Three Kingdoms" by Luo Guanzhong.

results.name: Game Box Série Corridas
results.description: Game Box Série Corridas is a compilation of three racing games that was published by Tec Toy and developed by Sega. It was released in 1994 in South America and Korea

results.name: The Crackwell Legacy
results.description: The Crackwell Legacy is a parody of The Blackwell Legacy.

results.name: Baldur's Gate
results.description: Bioware's first RPG, you must assemble a party of adventurers and investigate the mystery of the iron crisis and a darker threat that looms in the city of Baldur's Gate.

results.name: Final Fantasy XI Online: Treasures of Aht Urhgan
results.description: New Job classes, battle types, missions, quests, and more "player friendly" options highlight the third expansion for Final Fantasy XI.

results.name: Star Wars
results.description: This game, based on Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope, features both platforming and shooting segments.

results.name: Robo Rumble
results.description: A massive alien weapon is discovered on Mars and Earth has one year to prepare to fight the aliens who built it. Two arms manufacturers compete for the UN contract in an RTS with puzzle elements and an early use of a 3DFX accelerated 3D engine for the genre.

results.name: Squarez Deluxe!
results.description: An upgraded version of the independently-developed puzzle-strategy game Squarez.

results.name: Beyblade
results.description: Based on the hit anime series, players compete with spinning tops.

results.name: Nederland
results.description: An educational game to familiarize the player with the cities in the Netherlands.

results.name: Alexi Lalas International Soccer
results.description: A football game where players can manage the strategies and tactics of their team.

results.name: NBA Street V3
results.description: NBA Street V3 is the third entry in the popular NBA Street Series. Following in the footsteps of past games in the series, the game allows you to perform over the top dunks and tricks with your favorite NBA players.

results.name: Sid Meier's CivNet
results.description: A release of Sid Meier's Civilization but with added online multiplay.

results.name: Pac-Man World
results.description: A Pac-Man game set in a 3D world.

results.name: Serious Sam
results.description: Serious Sam on the Xbox packs in the first two PC releases along with slick graphical makeover and new multi-player options.

results.name: Sonic Advance 2
results.description: This sequel features a new character called Cream the Rabbit along with her Chao "Cheese". Dr. Eggman is at it again and its up to Sonic and friends to stop him.

results.name: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 07
results.description: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 07 is an iteration in the popular EA sports golf series. Starring Tiger himself, the game includes improved visuals over previous games and a large cast of superstar golfers such as Phil Mickelson and Vijay Singh.

results.name: Crash Bandicoot: The Wrath of Cortex
results.description: Crash Bandicoot: The Wrath of Cortex brings the fight to the sixth generation consoles while retaining a lot of the original concepts and ideas of the previously Playstation-focused franchise.

results.name: Iridion 3D
results.description: Iridion 3D was a launch title for the GBA. It was developed by Shin'en Multimedia and published by Majesco. It spawned a sequel, Iridion II and two spiritual successors in the form of Nanostray and Nanostray 2.

results.name: 7 Colors
results.description: 7 Colors is a puzzle game for the Atari ST, PC and Amiga.

results.name: CubeDrift
results.description: A puzzle game inspired by Sokoban type games, released in 2006 for Windows computers.

results.name: Math Blaster: Episode 1 - In Search of Spot
results.description: A sci-fi shoot 'em up which uses mathematical problems as gameplay mechanics. It has a space adventure theme.

results.name: Ancient Egyptian Mehen: The Forbidden Game of the Snake
results.description: A board game simulation based on a fictional Egyptian legend.

results.name: Castle Shikigami 2
results.description: Top-down shooter featuring a variety of witches and wizards aboard flying brooms, firing spells at incoming enemies. Features co-operative play and sold at a budget price in most areas.

results.name: SingStar '80s
results.description: The fourth installment in the SingStar franchise and the first era-specific release, SingStar '80s compiles chart-topping songs from throughout the decade.

results.name: Samurai Jack: The Shadow of Aku
results.description: A game based on the cartoon Samurai Jack.

results.name: Deflektor
results.description: A puzzle game in which each of the 60 screens has a laser and a target and the aim is to connect the two using optical devices like mirrors.

results.name: Ruff and Reddy in the Space Adventure
Skydiving Extreme
results.description: Skydiving Extreme is a skydiving game for the PlayStation.

results.name: Saboteur
results.description: Unrelated to the 2009 sandbox WWII game, Saboteur! was an early example of the stealth genre, two years before Metal Gear.

results.name: Mensch Ärgere Dich Nicht!
results.description: A board game simulation based on a German board game, much like Ludo or Parcheesi.

results.name: Fernandez Must Die
results.description: A vertical shooter similar to Commando that was released on many early computer systems.

results.name: Balloon Fight
results.description: Balloon Fight is an arcade-style platform action game for 1-2 players that is similar to Joust. Players take to the sky and try to pop their foes' balloons before their own get popped.

results.name: The Immortal
results.description: The Immortal is an isometric adventure game which puts you in the shoes of an apprentice wizard who sets out to rescue his old mentor from a trap-filled dungeon.

results.name: Arabian Nights
results.description: Falsely accused of Sorcery, Sinbad Junior has to escape prison and travel through various worlds to rescue the princess and defeat the evil Vizier

results.name: B-Wings
results.description: A vertically-scrolling Arcade shoot 'em up that was later ported to the Nintendo Famicom with a few changes.

results.name: Thexder 95
results.description: Thexder 95 (a.k.a. "Thexder for Windows 95") is a re-imagining of the original DOS action game. The game features all new levels, cut-scenes, and a multiple window interface.

results.name: Flying Warriors
results.description: Flying Warriors is an action game which takes elements from the second and third Hiryu no Ken games.

results.name: Power Instinct
results.description: The first in Atlus's signature fighting game series, featuring a competition (that gets more bizarre as the series goes on) where all of the combatants are descendants of the same bloodline.

results.name: Crypt of Medea
results.description: An adventure game written by Arthur Britto and Allan Lamb.

results.name: Kao the Kangaroo
results.description: A cartoonish platform game about a wacky kangaroo.

results.name: Serious Sam: Next Encounter
results.description: A console-exclusive installment in the Serious Sam series.

results.name: John Elway's Quarterback
results.description: John Elway's Quarterback is a vertical-scrolling Football sim that features the former Denver Broncos quarterback's likeness. Originally released in Arcades, it was later ported to various home systems.

results.name: Hodj 'n' Podj
results.description: A puzzle based minigame compilation tied around a loose narrative involving the rescue of princesses by the titular heroes, Hodj and Podj.

results.name: ArtRageous!
results.description: An edutainment game which aims to teach players about art.

results.name: Corsarios
results.description: Battle your way through an island full of pirates and then battle your way through a ship full of pirates to rescue the damsel in distress.

results.name: Area 51
results.description: Everybody's favorite secret military facility is being overrun by escaped aliens, and it's up to the S.T.A.A.R. to clean up the mess in this 1995 light-gun shooter by Atari.

results.name: Monty on the Run
results.description: Monty has broken out of Scudmore prison, and is on the run. Get him on the next boat out of here in the third Monty Mole game.

results.name: Dynamite Bowl
results.description: A bowling simulator for the Famicom. It allowed for up to five players and was the first bowling game for the system.

results.name: Sid Meier's Civilization II
results.description: The second game in the famous turn based strategy series by Sid Meier.

results.name: Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance
results.description: Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance serves as the first incarnation of the Fire Emblem franchise to embrace the realm of the third dimension while continuing the series' focus on turn based combat in a medieval setting.

results.name: Yu-Gi-Oh! Forbidden Memories
results.description: Use your cards and battle in this game based on the popular anime.

results.name: Daytona USA
results.description: Daytona USA is a remake of the Saturn and Arcade racing classic that adds courses, cars, and online play into the mix. It was released as Daytona USA 2001 in Japan and PAL regions.

results.name: Elvira: The Arcade Game
results.description: A platform game where you play as the mistress of the dark herself.

results.name: Kingdom Under Fire: The Crusaders
results.description: Kingdom Under Fire takes the action of the Dynasty Warriors franchise and mingles in strategic elements from the RTS genre

results.name: Ultima VII: The Black Gate
results.description: The Avatar returns to the world of Britannia to face a new threat from a mysterious cult and its enigmatic god known as the Guardian in the seventh game of the Ultima series.

results.name: Commander Keen 2: The Earth Explodes
results.description: Episode 2 of the story about Commander Keen.

results.name: X-Men: The Official Game
results.description: Take the role of Wolverine, Iceman and Nightcrawler and use their superpowers through a series of missions.

results.name: Harpoon
results.description: Harpoon is a realistic real-time tactics game that emphasizes quick and accurate decision making. It is based on a miniature table top game by Larry Bond.

results.name: Super Thunder Blade
results.description: Super Thunder Blade is a shooter casting the player as a helicopter pilot tasked with, almost, single-handedly defeating an enemy army. Super Thunder Blade was one of the two original Japanese launch titles for the Mega Drive. The other was Space Harrier II.

results.name: The Black Mirror
results.description: A point & click adventure game that details the death of William Gordon, and his grandsons attempts to solve the mystery behind his supposed suicide.

results.name: The Revenge of Shinobi
results.description: Often considered the franchise's pinnacle, The Revenge of Shinobi features a wide variety of locations, and a soundtrack by Yuzo Koshiro of Streets of Rage fame. In early versions, it also featured bosses who bore a striking resemblance to characters not owned by Sega.

results.name: David Douillet Judo
results.description: Sport Simulation game based of Judo.  David Douillet was a popular Judoka from France who has won gold medals in the Olympics. That is why the game was named after him.

results.name: Natural Selection
results.description: NS blends first-person combat with real-time strategy. It features intense "marines vs. aliens" teamplay, where one marine can become "Commander" and leads players from a top-down perspective.

results.name: Street Fighter II: The World Warrior
results.description: The one-on-one arcade fighting game that kicked off the "fighting game revolution" of the 1990s. Play as one of eight martial artists and travel the world to knock your opponents out of the tournament!

results.name: CheetahMen II
results.description: CheetahMen II is an unreleased sequel to a minigame originally on Action 52 for the Nintendo Entertainment System and Sega Genesis. It is infamous for its mediocre gameplay and highly buggy programming state.

results.name: Metal & Lace: The Battle of the Robo Babes
results.description: 2D eroge fighting game for the PC released in 1993 by Forest Games

results.name: Command & Conquer: Red Alert
results.description: Set in an alternate universe, Command & Conquer: Red Alert shows the reality of a different World War II where a powerful Soviet Union under leader Stalin tries to seize power over large areas in Asia & Europe.

results.name: SimEarth: The Living Planet
results.description: Somewhat similar to the hit Maxis game SimCity, SimEarth: The Living Planet gives the player complete control of a planet, and must find a way to develop sentient life.

results.name: LEGO Star Wars: The Video Game
results.description: A family-friendly video game adaptation of the Star Wars prequel trilogy, styled in the LEGO Star Wars line of toys.

results.name: Tokyo Xtreme Racer Zero
results.description: Tokyo Xtreme Racer Zero is a street racing game based on the highways of Japan's capital city.

results.name: Moero! Nekketsu Rhythm Damashii Osu! Tatakae! Ouendan 2
results.description: This time, the cheerleaders save the world with more songs, more insanity, and a rival cheerleading team.

results.name: Tales of Phantasia
results.description: The first entry in the "Tales" RPG series, Tales of Phantasia centers around a group of unwitting time travelers as they try to stop the Evil King Dhaos and reverse the decay of their world.

results.name: Shengnü zhi Ge: Heroine Anthem: The Elect of Wassernixe
results.description: Heroine Anthem is a Chinese PC RPG loosely based off Scandinavian mythology.

results.name: Grandia III
results.description: The fourth game in the Grandia series, Grandia III concerns a young man who wants to fly more than anything else in the world.

results.name: Stubbs the Zombie in Rebel Without a Pulse
results.description: Rise from your grave, eat the brains of the living, build an army of the Undead, and bring an entire city to its knees. Nice job for a day's work.

results.name: Z.A.R.
results.description: A Russian first-person shooter.

results.name: The Dam Busters
results.description: A cross between a simulator and an arcade game in which the player has to fly a Lancester bomber and drop bombs over dams in Germany during World War II. Whereby all flight crew positions(pilot, front gunner, tail gunner, bomb aimer, navigator, engineer) are controlled by the player.

results.name: Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon S: Kurukkurin
results.description: A Sailor Moon S licensed puzzle game for the Super Famicom where the player has to capture all three of the mystical talismans before their opponent.

results.name: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation - Hard Evidence
results.description: Team up again with the Las Vegas Police Department CSI team and see if you can crack five new cases in this fifth CSI game featuring a revamped interface and fresh graphics.

results.name: Golden Sun
results.description: Golden Sun sees the player travel Weyard to stop the release of Alchemy before it destroys the world.

results.name: Odama
results.description: A real-time strategy game with pinball style gameplay controlled via voice commands.

results.name: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Advanced Warfighter 2
results.description: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Advanced Warfighter 2 puts the player back into the action as a member of the Ghost squad as they try to stop prevent the Mexican Civil war from spilling over into the USA

results.name: Fantasy Zone: The Maze
results.description: A spin-off of the shoot-'em-up Fantasy Zone series, combining elements from the original game with the maze-like gameplay of Pac-Man.

results.name: Gaelic Games: Football 2
results.description: Gaelic Games: Football 2 is the second game in the Gaelic Games franchise. It was launched on November 7th 2007. It was launched beside Gaelic Games: Hurling

results.name: Alchemist Marie & Elie: Futari no Atelier
results.description: A role-playing game in the Atelier series for Wonderswan.

results.name: The Flintstones: The Rescue of Dino & Hoppy
results.description: A NES platformer where you play as Fred Flintstone as his pets Dino and Hoppy are kidnapped by a collector from the future. A small alien comes back in time to help them, and Fred must find the parts of his time machine to save them.

results.name: GT Legends
results.description: GT Legends is a racing simulator based on the Historic Racing Championships featuring cars from the 60's and 70's.

results.name: Pinky and the Brain: The Master Plan
Brunswick Circuit Pro Bowling
results.description: A bowling game published by THQ.

results.name: Wonder Momo
results.description: An action game presented as "hero show" developed by Namco.

results.name: Frozzic's Revenge
results.description: Free the magic birds and defeat the evil wizard Frozzic to save the Sky Kingdom in this puzzle game.

results.name: 4D Sports Boxing
results.description: Players create a fighter and attempt to take him to the top of the rankings in this 3D boxing game by Don Mattrick and Phil Harrison.

results.name: Rockman Complete Works: Rockman
results.description: A Japan-only compilation of the first 6 Mega Man games, this game introduced several new features, like hints, switching weapons without pausing, and memory card saves. These features were later used in the Anniversary Collection.

results.name: Hoyle Official Book of Games: Volume 1
results.description: A collection of six card game adaptations created by Sierra, most of which allow players to play against numerous AI opponents (including characters from other Sierra adventure games).

results.name: NASCAR 2005: Chase for the Cup
results.description: NASCAR 2005 revolutionizes NASCAR video games by adding the National, Craftsman Truck, and Featherlite Modified Series to the game, plus the all new Chase points format in an all new Chase for the Cup Mode.

results.name: F355 Challenge: Passione Rossa
results.description: F355 Challenge is a realistic racing sim developed by SEGA-AM2. It originally appeared in arcades in 1999, and soon after was ported to the Dreamcast and later to the PS2.

results.name: Speedball 2: Brutal Deluxe
results.description: Speedball 2: Brutal Deluxe is the most realised iteration of the Speedball franchise. Speedball is a brutal sport where armoured teams face-off in a metal-clad arena with the aim of beating down their rivals and scoring goals for fame and fortune.

results.name: Vampire Killer
results.description: The second game in the Castlevania series, Vampire Killer has the player taking control of Simon Belmont in his quest to defeat Dracula.

results.name: Hokuto no Ken 7 : Seiken Retsuden: Denshousha e no Michi
results.description: A fighting game based on the Fist of the North Star franchise. It is the third of three FoNS games for the Super Famicom.

results.name: Summon Night: Swordcraft Story
results.description: Swordcraft Story puts players in control of either Cleru or Pratty in their quest to become a Craftlord.

results.name: The Legend of Kyrandia
results.description: The first in a series of humorous fantasy point and click adventure games, it puts the player in the shoes of unlikely hero Brandon, who must stop the mad jester Malcolm from destroying the land.

results.name: African Raiders-01
results.description: Race through the desert on the African leg of the 11th Paris-Dakar rally.

results.name: Dare to Dream
results.description: An adventure game about a boy who gets trapped in his own dreamworld. Developed by Cliff Bleszinski and was his first game for Epic.

results.name: Nekketsu! Beach Volley da yo Kunio-kun
results.description: A volleyball game with all the usual Kunio-kun hijinks. It's the only game in the franchise centered around said sport.

results.name: Petka and VICH Save the Galaxy
Gangsters 2
results.description: From a small-time mobster to the leader of the Mob and all while on the quest for revenge.

results.name: Atomic Robo-Kid
results.description: The combat robot Atomic Robo-Kid is the only defense humanity has against the alien scourge in this multi-directional shoot 'em up from UPL.

results.name: B-17 Bomber
results.description: B-17 Bomber is a flight sim for the Intellivision, in which the player pilots a B-17 aircraft in bombing runs over continental Europe. It is one of only a few games to require the Intellivoice voice synthesis module.

results.name: Sqoon
results.description: The Earth is now underwater and being attacked by the evil Neptunians! Save all the imprisoned humans with a tricked-out pink submarine.

results.name: NASCAR Rumble
results.description: NASCAR Rumble is a arcade style racing game with power-ups, ala Mario Kart, based on the NASCAR franchise.

results.name: Donkey Kong
results.description: Control Jumpman (later known as Mario) and save his girlfriend, Pauline, from the evil barrel-tossing gorilla known as Donkey Kong. Designed by Shigeru Miyamoto, this was the game that set the template for the platformer genre.

results.name: Assault City
results.description: Assault City is a light gun, rail shooter released for Sega Master System 1990. Assault City makes full support of the Light Phaser.

results.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Warriors of the Eternal Sun
results.description: Set in the world of Dungeons and Dragons, Warriors of the Eternal Sun is an adventure RPG using a party system. Set in an unknown world populated with enemies, the heroes have to begin an epic quest for the sake of kingdom and culture.

results.name: Hell Cab
results.description: Hell Cab is a first person point and click adventure game that starts by taking the wrong cab in NYC. Stan is the cab driver; he brings the protagonist back in time to solve puzzles.

results.name: Rendezvous with a Stranger Girl
results.description: An adult dating sim mostly made up of FMV scenes.

results.name: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire
results.description: You're in the Hot Seat! You have 15 questions and 3 lifelines. This is just like the TV Show!

results.name: Duke Nukem 3D: Plutonium Pak
results.description: The Plutonium PAK is the name given to the purchasable patch that upgrades v1.3d of Duke Nukem 3D to v1.4, better known as "Duke Nukem 3D: Atomic Edition". Due to the scarcity of internet connections in 1997, the Plutonium PAK was also sold in retail.

results.name: Special Delivery: Santa's Christmas Chaos
results.description: Special Delivery: Santa's Christmas Chaos was a Commodore 64 game where you played as Santa Claus and must Catch Christmas presents while riding in a flying sleigh.

results.name: World Cup Year 94
results.description: World Cup Year 94 is a compilation of Sensible Soccer-European Champions, Striker, Goal!, and Championship Manager '93.

results.name: Race 07: The Official WTCC Game
results.description: Race 07 is a racing simulation game created by the famed SimBin development team.

results.name: Tecmo Classic Arcade
results.description: Tecmo Classic Arcade is a collection of eleven classic Tecmo games.

results.name: The Fish Fillets II
results.description: Solve over 100 puzzles in order to help the secret fish agents, Tina Guppy and Max Flounder, uncover an underwater mystery.

results.name: Athena: Awakening from the Ordinary Life
results.description: A survival-horror adventure RPG detailing the origins of Athena Asamiya, a character from The King of Fighters. The game is much darker than anything else featuring Athena.

results.name: Bloodwych: Data Disks Vol. 1
results.description: This expansion adds another 25 levels, 8 new spells and the ability to have monsters join your party

results.name: Quattro Super Hits
results.description: Quattro Super Hits is a complication of four classic Codemaster games that was released for systems like the Commodore 64, Amstrad CPC, and ZX Spectrum.

results.name: Baseball Advance
results.description: One of the first baseball games to appear on GBA. Covers the 2001 season

results.name: MissionForce: Cyberstorm
results.description: MissionForce: Cyberstorm is a turn-based strategy game set in the Earthsiege universe. Cyberstorm focuses on tactical combat with giant western-style robots.  The game includes alot of rich backstory and tons of customization for your squad.

results.name: Kikstart: Off-Road Simulator
results.description: Classic motorcycle racing game from 1985 developed by Shaun Southern (Mr Chip Software). Game was released for C64, ZX Spectrum and Atari 8-bit.

results.name: Tomb Raider II
results.description: The second title in the Tomb Raider franchise. Lara Croft races against the forces of Marco Bartoli in search of clues that will lead her to the Dagger of Xian, a powerful relic that allowed the Emperor of China to command his armies.

results.name: Crazy Kickers
results.description: Casual game developed in Germany.

results.name: Gravitation
results.description: Gravitation is Jason Rohrer's fourth game, with a similar aesthetic to Passage, his previous release.

results.name: Fallacy of Dawn
results.description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Robb Sherwin. Part one of the New Haz franchise.

results.name: Rome: Total War - Alexander
results.description: Rome Total war- Alexander is an expansion to Rome Total war released exclusively to valve's steam distribution center.

results.name: Wanted: Monty Mole
results.description: Monty Mole's first video game appearance seems him stealing coal from a coal mine. A mole has to keep warm, you know!

results.name: Super Jazz Man
results.description: Super Jazz Man is a superhero adventure game by Herculean Effort Productions. It plays very similarly to classic LucasArts adventure games.

results.name: Hammer of the Gods
results.description: Hammer of the Gods is a strategy / tactical combat hybrid released in 1994

results.name: American Gladiators
results.description: A competitive multiplayer action game based on the TV game show American Gladiators. Players compete against the clock and each other to complete events and obstacle courses.

results.name: King Neptune's Adventure
results.description: A fantasy action game published for the NES in 1990.

results.name: Creatures Adventures
results.description: Creatures Adventures was more of a sandbox then a simulation, like the other Creatures games, and was targeted toward a younger audience.

results.name: Gargoyles
results.description: A traditional 2D side-scrolling action game based on the mid-90s cartoon of the same name.

results.name: Heart of Africa
results.description: Heart of Africa, the unofficial follow-up to The Seven Cities of Gold.

results.name: Space Fury
results.description: Released by Sega in 1981, Space Fury was the first video game to feature colour vector graphics. It also featured ship power-ups.

results.name: Crash Bandicoot 2: N-Tranced
results.description: Crash Bandicoot 2: N-Tranced is the sequel to Crash Bandicoot: The Huge Adventure. It is a side-scrolling platformer, and features non-linear level selection.

results.name: Burnout 3: Takedown
results.description: Burnout 3: Takedown was first in the series to feature the signature takedown system for combating opponents. Revolutionizing the series, it has been the gameplay model for Burnout games ever since.

results.name: Exterminator
results.description: As an exterminator, players must rid Chicago's houses of insects, rats, and toy tanks by shooting, squashing, and punching them.

results.name: Bomberman Jetters
results.description: The spiritual successor of Bomberman Generation, Bomberman Jetters is loosely based on the anime of the same name.

results.name: FantaVision
results.description: FantaVision is a PlayStation 2 launch title that is a puzzle game based on quick color recognition.

results.name: Mystery Quest
results.description: A fantasy-themed Japanese side-scrolling platformer for the NES, developed by Carry Lab (or Carry Soft) and published in the US by Taxan.

results.name: Adventures in Math
results.description: Search for treasure in this mathematics-based educational game.

results.name: Need for Speed II
results.description: Need for Speed 2 is an arcade racer for the Playstation and PC where you race with freakin fast cars.

results.name: Tread Marks
results.description: Tread Marks is a tank combat game released by Longbow Digital Arts in 2000.

results.name: Indiana Jones in Revenge of the Ancients
results.description: Indiana Jones and in Revenge of the Ancients is text adventure developed by Angelsoft. It was released by Mindscape in 1987, for the Apple II and PC-DOS.

results.name: Murder in a Wheel
results.description: An adventure game for PC.

results.name: Aquanoid
results.description: Aquanoid is an Arkanoid clone that was released on DOS.

results.name: RISK: The Game of Global Domination
TRON 2.0: Killer App
results.description: Enhanced, Xbox-exclusive retooling of Tron 2.0 with a reworked single player campaign and refocused attention to its multiplayer gameplay.

results.name: Resident Evil: Deadly Silence
results.description: Deadly Silence is a Nintendo DS remake of the original Resident Evil that appeared on the Sony PlayStation.  The game adds touch screen and microphone mechanics that can be used throughout the game.

results.name: Waku Waku 7
results.description: Seven wacky characters fight over seven legendary balls to grant their greatest wish in Sunsoft's second 2D fighting game.

results.name: Spawn: The Eternal
results.description: First entry of the Spawn franchise on the Playstation system.

results.name: The Powerpuff Girls: Mojo Jojo's Pet Project
results.description: The Powerpuff Girls: Mojo's Pet Project is a PC action game based on the cartoon series.

results.name: Mortal Kombat: Deception
results.description: The sixth installment in the violent fighting game franchise, introducing a manual "Combo Breaker" system and online multiplayer while adding a more in-depth Konquest Mode.

results.name: Aces of the Pacific
results.description: From the bombing of Pearl Harbor to the hypothetical invasion of Japan battle across the Pacific in this classic flight sim.

results.name: Giga Wing 2
results.description: Sequel to the arcade hit. This game is ever more over the top than the last game, and the new reflect system causes all kind of carnage on screen.

results.name: Activision's Atari 2600 Action Pack
results.description: A compilation of Atari 2600 games.

results.name: Syndicate: American Revolt
results.description: Syndicate: American Revolt is an expansion developed by Bullfrog for the real-time tactical game Syndicate.

results.name: Uplink: Hacker Elite
results.description: Take on the role of a hacker in the year 2010.

results.name: Bunny Bricks
results.description: Bunny Bricks as ridiculed in the Mega Fun Party 3 demo

results.name: Ruiner Pinball
results.description: This Atari Jaguar pinball game contains two different virtual tables: "Ruiner" and "Tower".

results.name: The Humans 3: Evolution Lost in Time
Robotrek
results.description: An action RPG that lets the player build and upgrade robots to do battle against foes! Oh, and there's an Einstein lookalike.

results.name: Reggie Jackson Baseball
results.description: Reggie Jackson was a popular baseball player in the 70's and early 80's.  A year after he retired Sega released this baseball video game with his name and likeness on the title screen to America.  In Europe the game was simply called American Baseball.

results.name: James Pond 2: Codename: RoboCod
results.description: A side-scrolling platform game released in 1991. It is the sequel to the original James Pond, and now parodies RoboCop as well as James Bond.

results.name: Full Throttle
results.description: Full Throttle, also known as Top Speed, is an arcade racing game by Taito, released in 1987. It is similar in style to OutRun, with a fast red car hurtling through the U.S. countryside. The key difference in gameplay is the addition of a nitro boost button.

results.name: Riding Hero
results.description: A standard over-the-shoulder motorcycle racing game for arcades similar to the Hang-On series. Developed by SNK, it's known for its in-depth Story Mode, featuring a young unknown street racer's path to the professional racing circuit.

results.name: Startopia
results.description: A sci-fi management sim where you manage a space station that houses many different alien species.

results.name: Scenery Disk 6
results.description: Scenery Disk 6 is the sixth scenery expansion for subLOGIC's flight simulators.

results.name: Disney's Party
results.description: Ain't no party like a Disney Party, cause a Disney Party don't stop.

results.name: The Aquatic Games
results.description: An Olympic themed spin-off from the James Pond series in which Pond and his friends take part in an assortment of watery sports events.

results.name: King's Quest IV: The Perils of Rosella
results.description: The Perils of Rosella is the fourth title in Sierra's King's Quest series. The story returns focus to the now gravely ill King Graham and his daughter Rosella's quest to save him from death.

results.name: Tiny Troops
results.description: Tiny Troops is an action/strategy game created by Phoenix Interactive Entertainment for Amiga.

results.name: Actua Soccer 3
results.description: A soccer game for PlayStation and PC.

results.name: Raiden III
results.description: The third game in the top down scrolling arcade type shooter series.

results.name: Time Gate: Knight's Chase
results.description: An Action-Adventure game from the developers of Alone in the Dark.

results.name: Dawn Patrol
results.description: Dawn Patrol is a World War 1 combat flight simulator developed by Rowan Software and published by Empire Interactive. It focused on the exploits of famous WW1 fighter pilots such as the Red Baron and Eddie Rickenbacker.

results.name: NBA Hoopz
results.description: A sequel to NBA Showtime: NBA on NBC that introduced a 3-on-3 format to the ubiquitous NBA Jam formula of Midway basketball games.

results.name: Artillery Duel
results.description: A Two player game of skill and strategy as you try to knock out your enemy's gun emplacement.

results.name: International Karate 2000
results.description: Remake of the original International Karate, this game features 12 fighters along with new environments and a system link multiplayer mode.

results.name: The House of the Dead 2
results.description: 2 years after the Curien Mansion incident, strange activity has been coming from the city of Venice. The AMS has sent several agents to investigate the strange disappearance of locals there, but are you prepared for what lies ahead of you as one of them?

results.name: The Sims 2: H&M Fashion Stuff
results.description: In this small expansion from the popular Sims 2 you will gain access to more objects signed by H&M (shop) and will be able to design your own clothes to then post them on Maxis's website!

results.name: Larry Vales II: Dead Girls are Easy
Ollie's Follies
results.description: Dodge the robots and find the exit in this platformer from Fanda.

results.name: ScubaVenture The Search For Pirate's Treasure
results.description: An underwater action game developed by Apogee.

results.name: Last Mission
results.description: A multi-directional scrolling shoot'em up .

results.name: Donnie Darko: The Adventure Game
results.description: Donnie Darko: The Adventure Game is an unlicensed AGS adventure game, based on the 2001 film of the same name.

results.name: Wheel of Fortune: New Third Edition
Star Wars: X-Wing Alliance
results.description: The fourth in Totally Games' Star Wars flight simulator franchise.

results.name: Sneak and Snatch
results.description: A game accessed by scanning Pokemon cards into the Game Boy Advance E-Reader.

results.name: Strike Fleet
results.description: Strike Fleet is a naval military simulator in which the player commands a fleet of warships in real-time through a series of missions inspired by real-life conflicts.

results.name: Asteroids Hyper 64
results.description: This is a re-imagining of Asteroids for the N64 developed by Syrox Developments.

results.name: Chuck Yeager's Advanced Flight Trainer 2.0
results.description: A flight sim with lots of aircraft to choose from and various flight modes.  Comprehensive flight training, race, formation and obstacle course are all available.

results.name: Tequila & Boom Boom
results.description: A western-themed adventure game for DOS.

results.name: Valis IV
results.description: Chronologically the final game in the side-scrolling Valis series. Unlike its predecessors, Yuko is not the main character. It is also the only game to be ported to a Nintendo system.

results.name: Endless Ocean
results.description: Simple controls, no time limit, and serene exploration! Dive into the blue on an endless vacation full of sea life and sunken treasure!

results.name: The King of Fighters 2001
results.description: The eighth installment of the King of Fighters series (and the first after SNK's bankruptcy), radically changing the traditional 3-on-3 team system to allow any combination of fighters and Strikers.

results.name: Incantation
results.description: Incantion is a fanntasy sidescroller made quite late in the life of the SNES. Watchoo know about wand-shooting?

results.name: Makai Kingdom: Chronicles of the Sacred Tome
results.description: A demon overlord who's soul is bound to a book tries to restore his lost powers in this comedy JRPG.

results.name: X-Tension
results.description: X-Tension is the expansion pack to X: Beyond the Frontier.

results.name: Need for Speed: High Stakes
results.description: A high octane racer in which players race against the competition, as well as the police, in a high stakes game where players put their car on the line to win it all and come out on top.

results.name: FIFA Soccer Manager
results.description: The first FIFA manager game released in 1997 by EA.

results.name: Super Play Action Football
results.description: Super Play Action Football is one of the only games that features High School, College, and NFL teams.

results.name: Summer Heat Beach Volleyball
results.description: Summer Heat Beach Volleyball is a PlayStation 2 exclusive volleyball game.

results.name: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Double Agent
results.description: Splinter Cell: Double Agent puts a new spin on the series, placing Sam Fisher undercover in a terrorist group, where moral decisions affect gameplay.

results.name: X-Men: Wolverine's Rage
results.description: An action-platformer starring the X-Men character Wolverine.

results.name: Les Portes du Temps
results.description: A French adventure game.

results.name: Capcom Classics Collection: Volume 2
results.description: Another set of classic Capcom games for the PlayStation 2 and Xbox.

results.name: Space Ace
results.description: A Laserdisc-based animated reaction game. Space Ace must save his girlfriend, Kimberly from the evil alien, Borf in this follow up to Dragon's Lair.

results.name: Football Director
results.description: In this game the player can manage a soccer team in England. It was later released as a 2-player version renamed to "2 Player Super League".

results.name: Xianjian Qixia Zhuan 4
results.description: Xianjian Qixia Zhuan 4, also known as Chinese Paladin 4, was published and developed by Softstar Entertainment Inc. (Shanhai).

results.name: TinHead
results.description: Another character based platformer during the time when every company was trying to find their Sonic or Mario. Help Tinhead save the galaxy! Released only on the Genesis, developed by MicroProse Software.

results.name: Natural Fawn killers
results.description: Blow away cute animals in Natural Fawn Killers.

results.name: Smack Some Smackers
results.description: A violent pong style game that pits the Devil against a pig.

results.name: Neverwinter Nights
results.description: The very first graphical MMORPG.  Neverwinter Nights on AOL was developed by Stormfront Studios and published by SSI.

results.name: Grand Prix 3 Season 2000
results.description: The official add-on pack for Grand Prix 3.

results.name: Take Five CD-Rom: The Entertainer: Five Entertaining Titles In One Box
Z
results.description: Z is a real-time strategy game released in 1996 for MS-DOS, PlayStation, Sega Saturn and Windows. It is about two armies comprised of intelligent robots fighting to conquer several planets.

results.name: SwordQuest: FireWorld
results.description: The second of the SwordQuest series, this time it revolves around the Tree of Life. You still complete mini-games to get into rooms to switch objects to get comic book clues to solve the puzzle.

results.name: Spy Against Spy
results.description: Spy Against Spy is a bootleg of Spy vs. Spy programmed for the Dragon 32/64.

results.name: Delta Force: Black Hawk Down
results.description: Delta Force: Black Hawk Down is a first-person shoooter developed and published by Novalogic, based on the same events portrayed in the novel and film "Black Hawk Down".

results.name: Humbug
results.description: Humbug is a text adventure that was developed by Graham Cluley.

results.name: WWE WrestleMania 21
results.description: WWE Wrestlemania 21 is a fighting game based on 2004 fiction/cast of the WWE. It is also the last of the exclusive WWE Xbox games, being the successor to WWE RAW 2.

results.name: Final Soul
results.description: A text adventure game where you are trapped in a house. You must solve puzzles and riddles to escape.

results.name: ClayFighter
results.description: Crazy clay-based characters beat the clay out of each other in the first-ever claymation fighting game.

results.name: Balloon Challenge
results.description: Players compete to send hot air balloons higher into the sky than the opponent in this turn-based tactics game.

results.name: Electroplankton
results.description: Electroplankton is less a game with defined goals and more a free-form, music-generating device. Utilizing the stylus and often the face buttons, the player interacts with ten different species of plankton. Each species reacts differently to stimuli, resulting in unique sounds and musical combinations.

results.name: All-Pro Basketball
results.description: All-Pro Basketball is a basketball game for the NES.

results.name: G Darius
results.description: G Darius is a 2D shooter in the Darius series. It features series traditions like zone selection.

results.name: Micro Machines V3

results.name: Star Fox Command
