results.name: Tyrian
results.description:
Tyrian is a computer game developed by Eclipse Productions and orginaly published in 1995 by Epic MegaGames. In 1999 game was re-released as Tyrian 2000, featuring Windows compatibility, an additional fifth episode and bug fixes.
The game was officially released as freeware in 2004, and the graphics have been made available under an open license in April 2007.

results.name: The Thing
results.description: The semi-sequel to the 1982 sci-fi horror film.

results.name: Allan Border's Cricket
results.description: Audiogenic's second cricket game.  The game was sold in the UK under the name Graham Gooch World Class Cricket.

results.name: Giftpia
results.description: After oversleeping and missing his coming of age ceremony, Pockle must raise the money for another by helping out the citizens of Nanashi Island.

results.name: Platoon
results.description: Platoon is the video game based off of Oliver Stone's "Platoon".

results.name: Daigasso! Band Brothers
results.description: Daigasso! Band Brothers is a Rhythm Game for the Nintendo DS, released on December 2, 2004 in as a launch title. It was originally planned to be released on the Game Boy Color and then the Game Boy Advance.

results.name: Virtual Resort: Spring Break
results.description: Virtual Resort: Spring Break, or Beach Life which is it's European release name, puts you in control of a beach resort where you need to keep tourists and visitors happy by providing them with fun and thrilling beach activities, as well as watching out for their safety and well being.

results.name: Riana Rouge
results.description: A full-motion video, point-and-click action-adventure game rated (AO) Adults Only.

results.name: The House of the Dead
results.description: As AMS agents, G or Thomas Rogan, you are sent to investigate a panicked phone call from Rogan's fiancée, Sophie Richards and the disappearances of scientists working in the Curien Mansion. But can you prepare for what lies in the House Of The Dead?

results.name: The Crystal Key
results.description: An adventure game in the same vein as Myst.

results.name: Home Improvement: Power Tool Pursuit
results.description: Tim "The Tool Man" Taylor hammers his way into the Super Nintendo.

results.name: Toy Bizarre
results.description: Help to protect a toy store against waves of robots in this Activision platformer.

results.name: Rush Hour
results.description: Rush hour, also known as Speedster is a third person racing game developed by Clockwork games and was released on the 30th may 1997.

results.name: Foxx Fights Back
results.description: A game in which the fox is the hunter.

results.name: Terracide
results.description: A Descent-inspired game that was published by Eidos Interactive.

results.name: Worms 3D
results.description: Worms 3D is the first game in the popular Worms series developed by Team17 to feature fully 3-dimensional graphics.

results.name: Pacific
results.description: Dive for adventure and fortune underwater in Pacific.

results.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Manhattan Missions
results.description: The only TMNT game released exclusively for PC. It has a unique control scheme with two modes, one for walking and the other for fighting.

results.name: NAM
results.description: One of the last 20th century Build games, NAM is set during the Vietnam War.

results.name: SkiFree
results.description: SkiFree is a popular game created in the early 90s in which players ski down an endless ski slope while attempting to avoid obstacles and earn points until inevitably being chased by yetis.

results.name: SWIV 3D
results.description: Arcade helicopter action game. The last entry in the SWIV/Silkworm series, switching from the top down 2D gameplay into a 3D voxel based world.

results.name: How to Weigh an Elephant
results.description: How to Weigh an Elephant is a DOS educational game for young children.

results.name: Super Monaco GP
results.description: Considered one of the best racing games of the 16-bit era, Super Monaco GP puts the player in the driver seat for a simulation of the 1989/90 F1 season. The game features both an arcade and 2-year championship modes.

results.name: Conan
results.description: A third-person hack and slash game featuring Conan the Barbarian only released in Europe.

results.name: Splatterhouse 3
results.description: Don the "Terror Mask" on the Sega Genesis/Mega Drive one final time to save Rick's wife and son from certain gruesome death in Splatterhouse 3.

results.name: Cosmic Ark
results.description: A space ship rockets from planet to planet to pick up pairs of aliens.

results.name: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
Pinball Dreams II
results.description: The sequel to Pinball Dreams with 4 entirely new tables

results.name: Hoyle Card Games
results.description: Hoyle Card Games is a collection of many different card based games.

results.name: Super Mario All-Stars & Super Mario World
results.description: An updated version of Super Mario All-Stars bundled for a short period of time with the Super Nintendo Entertainment System from December 1994, featuring the inclusion of Super Mario World.

results.name: Asheron's Call
results.description: A notable early MMORPG and the chief rival to EverQuest prior to the release of World of Warcraft.

results.name: Dream Mix TV World Fighters
results.description: A crossover fighting game in the vein of Smash Bros., Dream Mix TV World Fighters brings together characters from a diverse assortment of Konami, Hudson, and Takara franchises.

results.name: Boundish
results.description: A game full of pong like mini games, part of the Nintendo "Bit Generations" Series for the Gameboy Advance

results.name: Crypt Killer
results.description: Crypt Killer is a a light gun shooter featuring up to three player action, and plenty of Crypts to Kill.

results.name: War Times
results.description: A RTS game where you play as the Axis or the Allies in different fronts of WW2.

results.name: Pimpin 2.0
results.description: Pimpin 2.0 was a turn-based multiplayer strategy game centered around rival pimps battling to control territory and "resources".

results.name: Mega Man X8
results.description: When the plan for humans to colonize the Moon goes awry, it's up to Maverick Hunters X, Zero, and Axl to hunt down Mavericks in the eighth (and last) official installment of the Mega Man X series (bringing the gameplay more in-line with the series's roots).

results.name: War in the Gulf
results.description: The Iraqi Republican Guard have overrun the oilfields of northern Kuwait and it's you job to teach them a lesson with you M1 tanks.

results.name: WCW vs. the World
results.description: WCW vs. the World is less about official licenses, and more about the large numbers of wrestlers, moves, and options. Only 14 actual WCW (World Championship Wrestling) wrestlers are in the game, with the emphasis drawing from six wrestling federations from around the world.

results.name: Dark Rift
results.description: One of the first 3D fighting games released for the Nintendo 64, Dark Rift is a spiritual sequel to Kronos's earlier sci-fi fighter Criticom.

results.name: Static Shock
results.description: Static Shock was a 2D Platformer game, developed and published by Midway, which was cancelled before it was released.

results.name: Wrath of the Black Manta
results.description: An action platformer game that sees a ninja take on a group of kidnappers.

results.name: Rudra no Hihou
results.description: A late Squaresoft JRPG for the Super Famicom. Four disparate groups of adventurers attempt to prevent the extinction of the human race from a fated destroyer: the titular Rudra.

results.name: S.C.A.T.: Special Cybernetic Attack Team
results.description: Following the invasion of Earth by fish-like aliens, you must assume the role of a S.C.A.T. soldier and halt the onslaught!

results.name: The Bugs Bunny Crazy Castle II
results.description: The first sequel to the action-puzzle platformer Bugs Bunny Crazy Castle, with new enemies and puzzles. It's also known in some regions as either a Mickey Mouse game or a Hugo game.

results.name: Fur Fighters
results.description: Fur Fighters is a third-person shooter video game developed by Bizarre Creations for the SEGA Dreamcast, PlayStation 2 and PC platforms featuring six cuddly animals as the protagonists

results.name: Lexicon Word Challenge
results.description: A trio of word game set amidst a jungle backdrop.

results.name: Blood Bowl
results.description: Blood Bowl is a fantasy football title based on the tabletop game of the same name created by Games Workshop. Elves, Orcs, Dwarves and Men take to the football field and pummel thier rivals into submission before rushing to the end-zone for a touchdown.

results.name: Sherlock Holmes: Nemesis
results.description: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's legendary detective Sherlock Holmes has met his greatest foe: French gentleman burglar Arsène Lupin. The game follows Maurice LeBlanc's penultimate creation as he continuously challenges England's finest to a duel of wits over the nation's most treasured assets.

results.name: Bonkers
results.description: Bonkers stars Bonkers D. Bobcat, a policeman in training with dreams of becoming head of the police force.  Play in a variety of mini-games that are impossible to lose to ultimately help Bonkers reach his goal.

results.name: Resident Evil: Outbreak
results.description: A multiplayer-focused spin-off of the Resident Evil series, Outbreak challenges a group of survivors (either with computer-controlled companions or with other online players) against the T-Virus outbreak in Raccoon City.

results.name: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
results.description: Take control of the world's most famous wizard as he enters the school of Hogwarts.

results.name: Final Zone
results.description: A top-down mech shooter with an isometric perspective. It is the third game in the Final Zone franchise, known as FZ Senki Axis in Japan.

results.name: Spy Vs. Spy: Volumes I & II
The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie
results.description: King Neptune's crown has been stolen, and all evidence points to Mr. Krabs. Join Spongebob and Patrick on their journey to retrieve the crown and save their beloved friend from execution.

results.name: Colosseum: Road to Freedom
results.description: In Colosseum, you fight to work your way up to freedom in Rome's famous gladiatorial battles.

results.name: Spirit of Adventure
results.description: A role-playing game in which the player controls a group of six heroes and has to locate and unveil the secret of the lethal drug Opitar, that has created an addiction among the population.

results.name: Nightmare Creatures
results.description: In the year 1834, London is burning and it may or may not be caused by Adam Crowley’s horrifying experiments.  It’s up to a servant of God and a gymnast to defeat the Nightmare Creatures.

results.name: Magna Carta: Tears of Blood
results.description: Magna Carta: Tears of blood is a Korean RPG that was released for Sony's Playstation 2.

results.name: R:Racing Evolution
results.description: A sim-like racer released by Namco in 2003 for the Xbox, Playstation 2, and Gamecube.

results.name: C5 Clive
results.description: One of several games for the ZX Spectrum which mocked Sir Clive Sinclair's electric car venture, the Sinclair C5.

results.name: Mr. Angry
results.description: An action game in which the player is a  photo-journalist who moves quickly around the hotel trying to photograph women. First released under the title Stringer.

results.name: Wild 9
results.description: Wild 9 is a 2.5D platformer that allows players to grab and flail enemies around to solve puzzles.

results.name: Shadowrun
results.description: An online-focused shooter based on the tabletop RPG of the same name, giving players modern weapons as well as various magic abilities. It was the first game to allow cross-platform play between Xbox 360 and PC players on the same servers.

results.name: Tales of Eternia
results.description: Tales of Eternia is the third game in Namco's series of JRPGs, originally released in the US as "Tales of Destiny II" for the PlayStation.

results.name: Rugby
results.description: Twenty international teams, 600 players, and tournaments like VI Nation and Tri-nations are included in this sports sim.

results.name: Super Xevious
results.description: A vertical shoot 'em up and an update to the original game that contains new enemies.

results.name: Shinobido: Way of the Ninja
results.description: A stealth action game made by Acquire

results.name: Pathway to Glory: Ikusa Islands
results.description: Pathway to Glory: Ikusa Islands is a military turn-based strategy game for the N-Gage. It is a sequel to Pathway to Glory. The game system did not have any big changes compared to the prequel, the main difference being games focus on the Pacific campaign.

results.name: Future Wars
results.description: Future Wars is a third-person sci-fi point and click game released in 1989 for the PC, Amiga, and Atari ST. It is known as Time Travelers in Europe and Time Travelers: The Menace (Les Voyageurs du Temps: La Menace) in it's native France.

results.name: Wing Commander: The Secret Missions
results.description: An expansion for the original Wing Commander set between Wing Commander 1 and 2. The crew of the Tiger's Claw is sent to destroy a Kilrathi superweapon.

results.name: Sensible Train-Spotting
results.description: Sensible Train Spotting is an accurate simulation of the train spotting hobby. It was also Sensible Software's last release.

results.name: Hawkquest
results.description: The top-down action follow up to Laser Hawk.

results.name: Rayman 2: The Great Escape
results.description: Help to repair the damage done to the world and repel an evil pirate invasion in this critically acclaimed platforming adventure.

results.name: R.B.I. Baseball
results.description: One of the first console baseball games to include real MLB players. The players were super deformed and had no likeness to the real players other than their stats and their names.

results.name: Animal
results.description: A point-and-click adventure game with FPS sections. Set in the food-themed world of Snackopolis, you play the sausage Peperami, who must rescue the kidnapped scientist Pepereinstein.

results.name: Silent Hill 2: Restless Dreams
results.description: Silent Hill 2: Restless Dreams is an updated version of the original Silent Hill 2 released a month after the original version.

results.name: The Typing of the Dead
results.description: The Typing of the Dead is an educational game that focuses on enhancing one's typing skills through the slaughter of the undead.

results.name: NeoGeo Battle Coliseum
results.description: Various SNK series, from Fatal Fury to Metal Slug, collide in this 2-on-2 tag-team crossover fighting game from SNK Playmore.

results.name: You Found the Grappling Hook
results.description: The player explores a cave using a grappling hook and later acquires a pair of hover boots and an axe for mining gold.

results.name: King's Field
results.description: King's Field is a first-person, action-adventure rpg.  This FromSoftware-developed title is the second game in the series, but was renamed for US release because the original was never officially localized.

results.name: Star Ocean: The Second Story
results.description: Discover the world of Expel in this popular JRPG from Tri-Ace.

results.name: Doom II: Hell on Earth
results.description: After the events of Doom, Hell has found its way to Earth. The last living scientists develop a plan to evacuate what's remaining of the human race with enormous space ships. Unfortunately, the demons have taken control of the only spaceport, and it's up to the nameless space marine to take it back.

results.name: Asheron's Call: Dark Majesty Expansion Pack
Soltrio Solitaire
results.description: Soltrio Solitaire is... well, it's solitaire. On your Xbox 360.

results.name: Winzer
results.description: Winzer is a business simulation about the cultivation of wine. In this game you take control on a winery located in southern Germany and must reach a score of 1000 in order to win.

results.name: Sound, Graphics & Aircraft Upgrade for Microsoft Flight Simulator
Jewel Master
results.description: Side-scrolling action game where a hero known as the Jewel Master can mix and match various rings to create more powerful weapons.

results.name: Panoplia: The Full Armor of God
Rolling Thunder 2
results.description: In this side-scrolling action game, you once again play as an agent against the forces of GELDRA, ducking and shooting your way towards enemy headquarters.

results.name: Avencast: Rise of the Mage
results.description: Avencast: Rise of the Mage is an Action RPG with beat 'em up elements that follows a young wizard apprentice as he fights against invading demonic monsters.

results.name: Heroes of Might and Magic IV: The Gathering Storm
results.description: New episode in the Heroes of Might and Magic saga. Allows the control of more units, fight in more maps and new storyline.

results.name: Lode Runner
results.description: Lode Runner is a 2D platform/Puzzle game from 1983 created by Douglas Smith. It is one of the first games to include a level editor tool for players to create their own levels.

results.name: Emerald Dragon
results.description: Emerald Dragon is a traditional Japanese RPG released for various gaming consoles and computers.

results.name: Jazz Jackrabbit 2
results.description: Jazz Jackrabbit is back in his second adventure, this time accompanied by his brother Spaz.

results.name: The Elder Scrolls Adventures: Redguard
results.description: Redguard is an action adventure game set hundreds of years before the events of the rest of the Elder Scrolls series.

results.name: How to be a Complete Bastard
results.description: A game based upon the famous book by Adrion Edmonson where you go to a party and try to be a complete bastard.

results.name: BreakQuest
results.description: BreakQuest is a new concept break-out-style game, featuring vibrant graphics, sparkling visual effects, and funky sound.

results.name: Laser Squad
results.description: Designed by Julian Gollop, Laser Squad is a turn-based strategy game which gives the player a squad of space marines to pit against a host of scenarios. The influence of this game can be seen today in titles such as the X-Com or UFO series and Laser Squad Nemesis.

results.name: MTV: Music Generator
results.description: MTV Music Generator is an easy to use music studio designed for the Sony Playstation. Using patterns, users are able to sequence their own melodies and rhythms which they can then place down in the sequencer.  Users also have access to effects, such as reverb and delay.

results.name: Gauntlet II
results.description: This 1986 sequel added more enemies with better AI, new treasures, harder levels, and the ability for each player to choose the character they wanted.

results.name: Missing: Since January
results.description: Missing (also known as "In Memoriam" in Europe) is a single player Alternate Reality Game. The story revolves around the disappearance of journalist Jack Lorski and his friend Karen Gijman. Jack and Karen had been investigating a series of murders.

results.name: Red Storm Rising
results.description: Red Storm Rising is a submarine simulation by Microprose. Players take command of a fast attack submarine in a series of missions that influence the outcome of World War III.

results.name: Kaizou Choujin Shubibinman Zero
results.description: A Super Famicom game in the Shubibinman series available initially as a download via the Broadcast Satellaview satellite service in Japan. It was later released on cartridge in 2017 by Columbus Circle for Japan.

results.name: Alien Carnage
results.description: Alien Carnage, also known as Halloween Harry, is a cartoon-style game featuring the titular Halloween Harry in a quest to rid the world of aliens.

results.name: U.S.A.A.F. - United States Army Air Force
Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego?
results.description:
Educational game in which you need to follow clues in order to find Carmen Sandiego. 
You will visit a lot of different locations all over the world.

results.name: You Don't Know Jack Movies
results.description: You Don't Know Jack: Movies follows the same formula as the rest of the series, but with a focus on movies.

results.name: Archon Ultra
results.description: A remake of the 1983 chess-inspired game Archon: The Light and the Dark.

results.name: The Black Onyx II: Search For The Fire Crystal
Videocart-1: Tic-Tac-Toe, Shooting Gallery, Doodle, Quadra-Doodle
Portal Runner
results.description: A spin-off of the Army Men franchise starring Vikki Grimm.

results.name: Gradius III and IV
results.description: A compilation for the PlayStation 2, containing both Gradius III and Gradius IV.

results.name: Hangman
results.description: Hangman is a game in which you guess the letters for a blank word while only knowing how many letters are in the word.  You must guess correctly before your man is hanged, each guess gets your man closer to being hanged.

results.name: Jane's Combat Simulations: Air Superiority Collection
Rocky
results.description: A boxing game based on the Rocky movies.  You play as Rocky and try to win the World Championship.  You'll fight against characters from the series as well as a few new ones.  You get to fight Apollo Creed and Clubber Lang.

results.name: Chaos Island
results.description: From Site B to San Diego, Chaos Island provides real-time strategy gameplay through the Jurassic Park universe.

results.name: My First Alphabet
results.description: This is a program to teach children their alphabet.

results.name: Sub Culture
results.description: An underwater action/adventure with trade based commodity gathering revolving around a centimeter-sized race of humanoid creatures engaged in civil war.

results.name: Moon Bugs
results.description: Players must protect earth from a swarm of alien insects.

results.name: Jak X: Combat Racing
results.description: A spin-off of the Jak and Daxter franchise that sees our heroes, fresh from saving the world in Jak 3, forced to participate in brutal races for their very lives.

results.name: Dragon Ball Z: Budokai Tenkaichi
results.description: An alternate fighting game take on the Dragon Ball manga and anime series, Budokai Tenkaichi utilizes a third-person perspective and unified movelists while adding a very large playable character roster.

results.name: The Heroes of Karn
results.description: The Heroes of Karn is an Interactive Fiction game with graphics and more unusually, music.

results.name: Contra Advance: The Alien Wars EX
results.description: The Game Boy Advance release of the SNES classic Contra III: The Alien Wars. It has minor changes to the original game, such as removing levels and changing graphics.

results.name: Mortadelo y Filemon II: Safari Callejero
results.description: A side-scrolling action game based on a Spanish comic series.

results.name: Breach 3
results.description: The last Breach in the series and was released on PC only.

results.name: PGA European Tour
results.description: This PGA Tour side game features five courses from across Europe. It was released around the same time as PGA Tour III and features a similar level of production.

results.name: NBA Street Showdown
results.description: The NBA Street franchise goes portable, with NBA Street Showdown.

results.name: Punishment
results.description: A punishingly difficult platformer in which one small mistake can result in the player having to repeat previously completed platforming segments.

results.name: Clonk Endeavour
results.description: Clonk Endeavour is a freeware strategy game for PC, a part of the Clonk series of 2D strategy games.

results.name: Black Market Bowling
results.description: Black Market Bowling is a European only bowling game for the Playstation 2.

results.name: Test Drive 2001
results.description: A Game Boy Color exclusive entry in the Test Drive series.

results.name: Virtua Fighter 5
results.description: The fifth main installment of Sega-AM2's signature fighting game series, using PC-based arcade hardware to deliver the most advanced graphical capabilities of video games in the mid-to-late 2000's.

results.name: Onefog Xonix
results.description: A variant of the arcade game QIX.

results.name: Mystaria: The Realms of Lore
results.description: An early Strategy Role Playing Game for the Sega Saturn.

results.name: Konami Krazy Racers
results.description: Konami Krazy Racers is a mascot kart racing game featuring characters and locations from Metal Gear, Castlevania, the Legend of the Mystical Ninja, and other Konami franchises. It is notable for being the first significant Kart racing game on the Gameboy Advance releasing months before Mario Kart: Super Circuit.

results.name: Magic Carpet 2: The Netherworlds
results.description: A game that allows players to fly around environments on a Magic Carpet while gathering mana, casting spells on enemies, and building castles.

results.name: Interpol: The Trail of Dr. Chaos
results.description: Interpol: The Trail of Dr. Chaos is a photo-hunt game which links screens which players must search using a story about Interpol chasing after antagonist Dr. Vladimir Chaosky.

results.name: Rance II: Hangyaku no Shoujotachi
results.description: Rance must save the town of Custom from its intended guardians, four young women with magical powers. However, there may be more to this situation than meets the eye.

results.name: Xanadu Next
results.description: A spin-off to the original Xanadu developed by Falcom for the PC and N-Gage.

results.name: Rejoice: Aretha Oukoku no Kanata
results.description: An action role-playing game from Japan Art Media and a spin-off of the Aretha series.

results.name: Galerians: Ash
results.description: Galerians: Ash is the sequel to Galerians that is an horror-survival game.

results.name: Kasumi Ninja
results.description: The Atari Jaguar's original answer to Mortal Kombat, which included similar levels of ninjas and violence (but lacked the eccentric characters, such as a Native American chief and a kilt-wearing Scot).

results.name: Ehrgeiz: God Bless the Ring
results.description: A 3D fighting game featuring free-form movement and guest characters from Square's hit JRPG Final Fantasy VII. The console version features a bonus action RPG built from the "Quest Mode" in the developer's earlier Tobal series.

results.name: Shrek 2
results.description: Shrek 2 is a video game based off the film of the same name. Players compete with four characters throughout eleven levels.

results.name: Metal Gear 2: Solid Snake
results.description: Originally released for the Japan-exclusive MSX2 in 1990, this sequel is set four years after the Outer Heaven incident. New FOXHOUND commander, Roy Campbell, brings a shell-shocked Solid Snake back from early retirement to infiltrate the military nation Zanzibar Land.

results.name: Perimeter: Emperor's Testament
results.description: Emperor's Testament is the only expansion pack for the real-time strategy game, Perimeter. It adds several new units and expands the game world's fiction, focusing on the Empire's "Mechanical Messiah" and the war against the Harkbacks.

results.name: Shogo: Mobile Armor Division
results.description: Shogo: Mobile Armor Division is a first-person shooter inspired by mecha anime, from developer Monolith. As Sanjuro Makabe, players engage in combat both on foot and in enormous suits of robotic armour called MCAs.

results.name: Death by Dark Shadows
results.description: Death by Dark Shadows is a Prince of Persia inspired platforming game by William R. Fisher III. Only a 5 level beta of the game is known to exist today, as the original code has been lost to time, and few copies of the full game were ever sold.

results.name: Star Rank Boxing
results.description: A boxing game featuring 20 different opponents. It is known as Barry McGuigan World Championship Boxing in the UK.

results.name: Star Raiders
results.description: This 3D spaceflight combat game helped launch the genre

results.name: Crash Bandicoot Purple: Ripto's Rampage
results.description: Crash Bandicoot teams up with Spyro the dragon to stop the world from being taken over by Cortex and Ripto

results.name: Summer Carnival '92: Recca
results.description: Summer Carnival '92 - Recca was only released in Japan, on July 17th 1992. The game is famous for its incredible speed, unique soundtrack, and relentless difficulty. It later was released worldwide on the 3DS eShop.

results.name: Star Saga: Two - The Clathran Menace
Brain Dead 13
results.description: An animated interactive movie game similar in play style to Dragon's Lair. The main character is a young computer technician named Lance who gets called to a spooky castle.

results.name: Black & White 2: Battle of the Gods
results.description: Battle of the Gods constitutes the final edition in Lionhead Studios' Black and White franchise, an overhead perspective city sim-type game in which the player plays the role of a god summoned by his people to aid them in a time of crisis.

results.name: School Tycoon
results.description: Build and expand a school in School Tycoon.

results.name: Astonia 3
results.description: Astonia is a free online role-playing game (MMORPG). Join this vast fantasy world as either a Mage or Warrior and explore the game world with thousands of other players. Make friends, amass huge amounts of game gold, create a powerful character or simply have fun playing this

results.name: Seek and Destroy
results.description: Known in Japan as "Shin Combat Choro Q", Seek and Destroy is a tank combat game in which the world of "Quewar" is populated not by people, but by tanks.

results.name: Traffic Giant
results.description: Traffic Giant is Public Transit tycoon game released in 2000 by JoWood Productions.  Players make public transit routes using various vehicles such as buses, street cars and subways from a top down isometric perspective.

results.name: Toilet Tycoon
results.description: Toilet Tycoon is an economic simulation game where players provide sanitation services for an entire town.

results.name: Math Munchers Deluxe
results.description: An educational game where players "munch" the correct answer to math problem.

results.name: Final Doom
results.description: Featuring two new 32-level episodes for Doom II: Hell on Earth, Final Doom is a community-developed standalone expansion that features some of the most difficult level sets (designed to finally break even the most hardcore of Doom veterans).

results.name: Nanosaur Extreme
results.description: Nanosaur requires players to change history by rescuing dinosaur eggs from destruction.

results.name: Bokosuka Wars
results.description: An early action-strategy-RPG game created by Koji Sumii and published by ASCII for the Sharp X1 computer in 1983. The game is considered a precursor to several genres: the action RPG, tactical RPG, real-time strategy, and tower defense.

results.name: NBA 2K2
results.description: NBA 2K2 brings the NBA 2K series of realistic basketball games to all sixth-generation consoles, updating the roster to the 2001/2002 NBA season while adding a new "Fantasy Mode", where every player in the season is put into the drafting pool.

results.name: Ice Hockey
results.description: Ice Hockey is an ice hockey video game designed by Activision programmer Alan Miller, and published by Activision.

results.name: Heart of Darkness
results.description: When Andy's dog Whisky is kidnapped during a solar eclipse, the brave youth embarks on a 2D platforming adventure across dangerous alien landscapes to rescue him.

results.name: The Incredibles
results.description: The Incredibles stars a family of people with superpowers who try to conceal them from the outside world for fear of prejudice. Bob Parr has superhuman strength, Dash has super speed, Violet can turn invisible and project force fields and Elastigirl can stretch.
